'William Chester Minor', also known as 'W. C. Minor' (June 1834 – March
26, 1920) was an American army surgeon who, later, was one of the largest
contributors of quotations to the [[Oxford English Dictionary]]. He was held in
a lunatic asylum at the time.
categories: People acquitted by reason of insanity
United States Army Medical Corps officers
